summary: This document is a series of email exchanges on August 1, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein's condition at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The correspondence involves a request for notes on a reported suicide attempt or self-harm incident involving Epstein, with the Chief Psychologist providing cautious assessments and requesting a HIPAA authorization.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, with discussions about a possible suicide attempt or self-harm incident.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt Inquiry
events.description: Email correspondence regarding a request for notes on Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt or self-harm incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations.address: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The federal prison where Jeffrey Epstein was held; the location of the discussed incident and the workplace of the Chief Psychologist.

keyFacts: On August 1, 2019, there was urgent email correspondence regarding obtaining notes on Jeffrey Epstein's condition following a reported incident.

The Chief Psychologist at MCC New York described the incident as a 'potential suicidal gesture' and noted uncertainty over whether it was a ploy, an attack by someone else, or self-inflicted 'rug burn'.
The Chief Psychologist stated a HIPAA authorization was needed before releasing any notes on Epstein.
The emails show internal DOJ/BOP staff discussing Epstein's mental state and a possible suicide attempt just weeks before his death.
The correspondence indicates official awareness and documentation of an incident involving Epstein at MCC prior to his death.
